alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 5:22PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnston County through 615 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Benson, or 10 miles southwest of Smithfield, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Clayton, Benson, Micro, Selma, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Coats Crossroads and Flowers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
